## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

### Deliverable 1: Linear Regression to Predict MPG ###
```{r}
#load dplyr package
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
# read in csv as a dataframe
MPG <- read.csv(file='MechaCar_mpg.csv',check.names=F,stringsAsFactors = F)

head(MPG)
```

```{r}
#Multiple Linear regression
lm(mpg ~ vehicle_length + vehicle_weight + spoiler_angle + ground_clearance + AWD,data=MPG) 

# mpg =  6.267e+00vehicle_length + 1.245e-03vehicle_weight + 6.877e-02spoiler_angle + 3.546e+00ground_clearance + -3.411e+0AWD - 1.040e+02
```
```{r}
#generate summary statistics with p=value and r-squared value for linear regression model

summary(lm(mpg ~ vehicle_length + vehicle_weight + spoiler_angle + ground_clearance + AWD,data=MPG))

# p-value: 5.35e-11
# r-squared value: 0.7149
```
